site.title: Elias Marrow
site.author: Elias Marrow
site.description: Essays and analysis on power, incentives, constraint, and structural outcomes.

essays.title: Trump: Rhetoric, Incentives, and the Machinery Behind the Movement
essays.subtitle: Power, incentives, and institutional collapse
essays.author: Elias Marrow
essays.summary: A constraint-based analysis separating political rhetoric from material incentives, examining power, media dynamics, and institutional behavior.

essays.title: Joe Biden and the Illusion of Restoration
essays.subtitle: Power, normalcy, and the politics of managed decline
essays.author: Elias Marrow
essays.summary: Biden as caretaker: stabilizing institutions while structural decline continues—process over outcomes, continuity over confrontation.

essays.title: Constraint Awareness
essays.subtitle: A structural lens for seeing why outcomes harden
essays.author: Elias Marrow
essays.summary: A framework for analyzing behavior under scarcity: option sets, time horizon, proximity, certainty, friction, and how buffer expands agency.

essays.title: The Empire That Feared Itself
essays.subtitle: Fear as stabilizer, war as permanence
essays.author: Elias Marrow
essays.summary: A concise argument that fear compresses debate, justifies permanence, and sustains profit—when true existential threat is absent.

essays.title: The Lens We Use
essays.subtitle: Method, probability, power, and constraint
essays.author: Elias Marrow
essays.summary: An explanation of the analytical method used across this archive: outcomes-first reasoning, incentives, constraint, proximity, and power.

essays.title: The Silence in the Files
essays.subtitle: What survives, what vanishes, and who gets to decide
essays.author: Elias Marrow
essays.summary: A structural essay on record, memory, and institutional silence—how omission becomes policy and how absence becomes a weapon.

essays.title: The Environment Turned Against Us
essays.subtitle: Systems built for survival that outgrew the people inside them
essays.author: Elias Marrow
essays.summary: A structural argument that modern life was built from fear and efficiency—then scaled into systems that preserve function over human relief.

essays.title: Democracy Is Not Failing
essays.subtitle: It is being managed
essays.author: Elias Marrow
essays.summary: A structural argument that what looks like democratic failure is often a designed outcome of incentives, containment, and controlled legitimacy.

essays.title: Effort Was Held Constant
essays.subtitle: Effort is necessary—never explanatory
essays.author: Elias Marrow
essays.summary: A short piece reframing effort as a baseline requirement, not the variable that explains success or failure under constraint.

essays.title: When Poverty Becomes Functional
essays.subtitle: Poverty as baseline output, not personal failure
essays.author: Elias Marrow
essays.summary: A simulation-informed structural argument: poverty emerges as a predictable system output when constraints and option sets are held constant.

essays.title: Complicit by Silence
essays.subtitle: When silence becomes participation
essays.author: Elias Marrow
essays.summary: I avoid involvement where I can. But some forms of ignorance make silence a form of complicity.

books.title: What Was Required
books.subtitle: Archive edition
books.author: Elias Marrow
books.summary: Archive edition. A completed sequence examining pressure, legitimacy, and the moment restraint fails.

books.title: Constraints, Not Choices
books.subtitle: A short book
books.author: Elias Marrow
books.summary: A structural argument that outcomes emerge from constrained option sets—not moral failure.

books.title: Darkling — Book I
books.subtitle: A novel
books.author: Elias Marrow
books.summary: Book I archive edition. Chapters and supporting material are published as they are finalized.

books.title: The Weight of Knowing
books.subtitle: A novel
books.author: Elias Marrow
books.summary: An archive edition. The work publishes in sections as canon is locked.
